actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on December 20, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Wied moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. S. Con. Res. 46 — "Providing for corrections in the enrollment of S. 4367."
Mr. Wied asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 19.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Failed by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 174
actions-list.actionItem: 235, 1 Present (Roll no. 516).
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 10515.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Cole moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 10515 — "Making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 19, 2024, at 2:49 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 2620, S. 2742, S. 3123, S. 4129, S. 4209, S. 4511, S. 4607, S. 4994, S. 5000, S. 5125, S. 5136, S. 5595, H.R. 5443, H.R. 6062, and H.R. 8666.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on December 19, 2024, at 2:49 p.m.: That the Senate agrees to the House amendment to the bills S. 709, S. 3791, and S. 4367; that the Senate agreed to S. Con Res. 46; and that the Senate passed S. 432, S. 608, S. 961, S. 1059, S. 1088, S. 1760, S. 2018, S. 2042, S. 2151, and S. 2615. Appointment: National Commission on the Future of the Navy.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 19.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. LaHood to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mike Bost to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
